background.story: The man who conquered the Orvel Arena. Sitting on the throne of the champion, he is often feared by others. People refer to him as Beast Fist. However, he is actually a cheerful man with a positive and straightforward personality. As reflected by his fighting style, he is a bold man who does not hesitate to act upon his will. After his conquest, Gladi requested the right to run an Arena Shop. Supposedly, his real goal was to gain a monopoly on silvervines. It still remains a mystery as to who will actually buy these plants, but he seems happy enough. Curiously enough, he's currently not even selling any silvervines.

itemIntroductions.weapon: A pair of gauntlets custom forged for Gladi. They are the proof of his winning the championship at the Orvel Arena. Supposedly, these were crafted from a legendary pair of gauntlets used by a man who was known as the War God hundreds of years ago. These gauntlets, specialized for smashing the opponent, greatly enhance the power of their wearer. However, the physical cost of using them is brutal, and no normal person can handle them. Unless the wearer is incredibly flexible, and physically capable of withstanding the impact of each blow, using them is almost suicidal. Nevertheless, Gladi's natural strength and flexibility allow him to use them freely.
itemIntroductions.soul:
Gladi received an impressive reward for conquering the Arena, but he had one concern. Gladi could not help but sense something odd about Mastra, the weapon he received as a token of his victory. Gladi was sure that he was controlling Mastra as he wished, but he realized at one point that Mastra was moving on its own, 'matching' his movement. Gladi brainstormed for the answer all night, but he eventually fell asleep with Mastra by his side.
In His dream, Gladi saw a massive lion that was staring at him. Gladi didn't know why, but he was happy to see the lion. However, when he waved his hand, the lion rather responded coldly.

'You are just a wee pup, and you are far from being ready. You are in no position of greeting me.'

Gladi, upset by the lion's remark, asked the lion back. However, the lion replied coldly, 'I do not have to answer your question.' Gladi, enraged with the lion who was being dismissive, fought with the lion to hear his answer. After a long fight, Gladi managed to defeat the lion.

'I would like to have my answer now.'
'Another question that does not need to be answered.'
treasures: You just can't stop throwing punches! The mysterious feather wavering before the eyes pushes Gladi's concentration to its limit so that he can land strikes at a crazy speed. Gladi seems a bit too excited when he's looking at it.

Silvervine is used to exponentially boost physical ability. Nothing else, but this silvervine. Others may try chewing silvervine, drink it, boil it, but it won't work. Gladi just needs this silvervine to have the effect of the War God.

Wreath given to the strongest warrior of Orbis Continent. It's only given to the winner of the fighting tournament that happens every 4 years. Those who wear this wreath are said to be able to borrow the strength of the War God.

A roll of elastic bandage that Gladi wears around his fists when someone really needs a good punch to the face. It was a present that his master gave him a long time ago. Gladi rarely gets mad after he started to work at the shop in the Arena, but he would take the bandage out for nasty customers who keep whining that they need weapons that exceed their capabilities, or those who dishonor the War God, whom he respects dearly. Gladi is a big-hearted man who knows how to let things go with a good laugh, but if you see him wrapping the bandage around his fists silently, that could be your last day.
